intro: Sebaea schinziana, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling small snowflakes. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sebaea schinziana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking floral display.
